title: 1963–64 Yorkshire Football League
text:
The 1963–64 Yorkshire Football League was the 38th season in the history of the <a href="Yorkshire%20Football%20League">Yorkshire Football League</a>, a <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition in <a href="England">England</a>. At the end of the season Division Three was disbanded.
Division One.
Division One featured 12 clubs which competed in the previous season, along with four new clubs, promoted from Division Two:
Division Two.
Division Two featured ten clubs which competed in the previous season, along with five new clubs.
Also, Brodsworth Main changed name to <a href="Brodsworth%20Welfare%20A.F.C.">Brodsworth Miners Welfare</a>.
Division Three.
Division Three featured seven clubs which competed in the previous season, along with two new clubs:
